website_summaries.verdict: The Dymo LetraTag Plus LT-100T standalone label printer is an inexpensive, portable choice for printing paper, plastic, iron-on, and metallic labels without a computer.
pros: Choice of paper, plastic, iron-on fabric, or metallic labels
cons: Keyboard lacks number keys above the QWERTY layout, using a shift function with embedded numeric keys instead

customer_reviews.title: Letters print unevenly, labels look sloppy
customer_reviews.text: It works okay and is easy to use, but the printing of letters that hang lower (p, g, q) is off. The font of those letters is smaller in order to cram them into the same lateral area as the non-hanging letters (see photo). The result is that the labels look sloppy and uneven, not clean and organized. The font is also blurry/pixelated and there are not different font options like I had thought. Overall, poorly designed product and I wish I had gone with a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Makobleiu

customer_reviews.title: Dymo label maker
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought the smaller, non QWERTY version, and I used it a bunch. I hate alpha letters, though, considering we type all day on QWERTY keyboards. So, I got this one for myself. 4 batteries is a bit of a throwback to 80s toys, but whatever. Rechargeable or HF batteries do the trick. What I cannot stand about label makers is the preceding/succeeding amount of tape. Print a huge label? Ok, I could argue it. But a short label (or small text) doesn't need to have nearly 1/2" of extra tape on it. It's wasteful and only serves the purpose of using more tape so you have to buy more sooner. Still 4 stars, though.
customer_reviews.author: Big Trev

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Arrived and is completely broken. Doesn’t print correctly. Everything jams. Wasn’t able to return in the time allotted due to health issues so I am stuck with a useless label maker. I got it since I have right hand paralysis and I thought it would help with organization, but everything that could go wrong with it did.
customer_reviews.author: Jules1943

customer_reviews.title: Lots of great options but there are a few problems
customer_reviews.text: First off, the labels dont peel, i and my mother worked and worked to remove the film and no luck, so i had to tape it on. 2nd, i put fairly new batteries in it and it says low battery. I do like the big keyboard for my middle aged eyes. The labels print great and the options are plenty. Great label maker for the most part. Shipped fast, arrived in 2 days. Oh and the last issue, false advertising, on amazon it said comes with two extra ribbons, not. It came with one extra. Takes a lot of batteries but i was warned on advertisment about that.
customer_reviews.author: motor cycle lover

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a few months and then ...
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoyed this product when first purchased less than 6 months ago. I liked being able to make nice labels very quickly. However I tried to use the label maker this week and it would not power on. I haven’t used it in a month or two so I tried changing the batteries. It flashed on once w the “dymo” screen then nothing. Can’t get it to power up again so it’s not the batteries... money wasted. I used it maybe a total of 10 times and paid more expecting a quality product. Disappointing
customer_reviews.author: K Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Returned it!
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this product. I've used DYMO label makers in the past and really like them overall. However, this particular unit would not print at all. I tried changing font sizes and styles, but nothing helped. I contacted DYMO customer service, which got back to me pretty quickly with some suggestions on how to fix the issue. Didn't work. They even called me to let me know how to proceed. Returned it within 4 days of receipt. I've asked for a replacement unit, which I HOPE will work this time.
customer_reviews.author: DCP Laker Fan

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought one sooner
customer_reviews.text: This LT-100 plus is great. I was missing out and should have bought one sooner. You will be amazed how handy this little item is.I bought this to label wires for a camera system and network rack. Now I practically label everything. It feels well made, very durable and comes with paper labels. I bought additional plastic labels for out door use. Great little tool to have around. If you do a lot of outdoor/on the go labeling I would recommend the hand held over the desk top version.Easier to carry around. I am purchasing another (Hand Held) just for an addition to my little tool bag. Very please with this item.Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Great print quality.
customer_reviews.text: Easiest label maker ever. I have bought this model twice now. I use it all the time. The first one got destroyed when my cat knocked it off the table and broke the screen, and I bought this one to replace the first one. I label everything from items in the pantry, to aquarium equipment and power sources for my electronics. Easy to use, easy to change letter size, add decorative flare with little symbols. Print quality it better than I expected from it.
customer_reviews.author: Lyz

customer_reviews.title: Decent Quality & Performance using A/C Adapter for Printing.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad at all. Certainly an improvement over the old embossing labellers Dymo used to sell. I still have one LOL. The small printing isn't laid out well for multiple lines, but the larger sizes look decent, if a little bitmapped-looking, and I like the Italic setting. One word of caution, even the best batteries will not print for long in this device. They're fine for typing and formatting your label, but when it's time to print you'll want to use an A/C adapter to get the best results. Without it, you will probably not be happy with the output from the thermal print heads, unless your batteries are alkaline and relatively new.
customer_reviews.author: Super Shopper

customer_reviews.title: great machine
customer_reviews.text: The label maker is great the printing is nice and everything is pretty easy to use for my mother of a certain age. The paper is heat sensitive so no ink and the refills sell everywhere and are cheap and plentiful on here along with a lot of paper options. The print button is big so mom can see it. The only problem I have with this is the screen isn't very good its like a non backlit calculator so its kinda hard to see but compared to others the screens the biggest u can get for the price so she will have to just wear her glasses. Its a good little machine for the price. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cadiacaine

customer_reviews.title: Covers all the basics.
customer_reviews.text: The 2-line mode doesn't work so well and some of the font sizes look a bit screwy, but it you're looking for basic labels and to print on paper, plastic, clear, and metallic, then this will get the job done for you.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Arno

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to operate as other label makers
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 2 months. It is ok. I have not experienced the print issues in some reviews. I found the way the label maker keyboard is set up is not great. It is pretty hard to find things, Basically less intuitive to use. I do not like that the font size reverts after each print and does not stay on the selected setting. I think I waste tape due to this.
customer_reviews.author: D. G

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Quality Product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit for my office when my 10+ year-old Dymo LetraTag LT-100H Personal Label Maker ceased to print clearly. All of the same functionality from the old unit, but with the QWERTY keyboard, and comfort of the unit being held in two hands, I no longer feel the bit of apprehension that used to come with making labels on an ABC keyboard and now feel a sigh of relief from my body and mind every time I need to compose a label. Composing on this unit is almost easier than texting on a smartphone. Printing on plastic or paper both work great. After 2 months of regular use, I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Had to return, screen too dim.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my old dymo which was about 15 years old(which still worked with one minor screen glitch). This one seemed great but I could not get over how dim the screen was. I have 20/20 vision.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: It only worked once. Then it said "Tape Jam" ...
customer_reviews.text: It only worked once. Then it said "Tape Jam". There was no tape jam. Googled how to fix it. That did not work. Not returnable. Not fixable.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Works good, does not accept a power unit
customer_reviews.text: Works good but sometimes the text appears a little odd looking depending on how you size it and if you add a second line. WARNING, this unit DOES NOT accept a power unit! It runs on BATTERIES ONLY! The listing should make that obvious since it seems that some reviewers bought a power unit only to discover this fact. I gave it only 3 stars because the listing was not clear on this.
customer_reviews.author: MikeJA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome label maker!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use label maker! Straightforward, all you have to do is put in some batteries and type what you want to print. I wish the display was a little brighter and easier to read the words but other than that, this is a very good label maker. The adhesive tape it comes with also seems to work just fine and I have no problems with the adhesive. I love the cute borders you can print out as well!!! The alligator one I made is so stinkin' adorable.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Bend Label Tape Horizontally !
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased and so far so good, but I couldn’t get the backing off the adhesive label tape. I called the help center. You have to bend the tape HORIZONTALLY. It’s easy to remove. It’s not intuitive to do this, but works beautifully. I suggested they add this to their quick reference guide as I’ve seen reviews here complaining that buyers can’t get the backing off the tape.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Made labels for school supplies, for everything from individual crayons to folders to backpack. 1st day of school was today, so time will tell how well the labels hold up, but so far I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W.

customer_reviews.title: Power switch failure after light use.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 1 1/2 year ago. Worked fine in beginning. Very lightly used. Has been stored away in-house and not near a damp area for past 6 months with batteries removed as per directions. Tried to turn on and power switch won’t work. Fresh batteries inserted. Of course, it’s out of warranty. Definitely won’t purchase a replacement. Designed to only last one year?
customer_reviews.author: M Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Previous one stopped printing right.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace the previous one that suddenly stopped printing properly. I just love making labels so, that I bought the same one again. There really isn't any better product available, but I really feel I shouldn't have had to replace the old one. It should still be working.
customer_reviews.author: LUCIA J FIERO

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE!! This is my second one as the first one had an issue with some cheap batteries exploding in it. Anyway. Its very user friendly. It is fast to print with a clear screen. It is easy to work with soft buttons that are easy to press. I love this for projects all over the house. I even used the plastic labels in the garden to mark my plants. This is one of my favorite things to use in my house. I often use it in the kitchen to mark the date when things were opened. Its used in my closet to write what is in boxes. It makes things look neat and clean even when they are not!
customer_reviews.author: GROZ

customer_reviews.title: Great product with Ironton label option.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Brother label maker for years, and it died a peaceful death from age and use. When replacing it, I almost skipped the DYMO brand, as I was not familiar with it. I'm so glad I read more! For about $2 than the current version of my old one, this offers more functionally. You can save labels you will need more of, it has a qwerty Iskandar keyboard, and changing the format is easier. It uses less tape per label, but I'm comparing to an old brother. As a sewer, I'm looking forward to trying the Ironton tape.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: AC Adapter not an option.
customer_reviews.text: Caveat Emptor!!! The owner's manual and Amazon product description are screaming at me, now. There is no mention of using an AC adapter with the present 100T. Must be a recent omission because the hole for the plug is still there, just empty inside. I will be using rechargeable AA cells I guess. I assumed there was still an option to use wall power, my mistake. This one issue would have swung the decision to buy this instead of the Brother P-Touch. I'm staying away from this brand name in the future for anything..'I'm signing this review "One Pissed Off Former Customer"
customer_reviews.author: JTH

customer_reviews.title: Dymo is a good Label Machine is great!!
customer_reviews.text: My first time buying Dymo Label Machine. This actually a good product! Easy to use, easy to learn and easy putting label tape in. The quality of the print is good and readable.
customer_reviews.author: Ibanie

customer_reviews.title: A Decent Product for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: Performs as advertised. No problem so far. Written instructions easy to follow. One "Con" so far is that the Keypad keys soil easily and would require frequent cleaning. Hope that this doesn't result in the "IDs" fading away. Sluggish operation occurs when batteries are weak. This item should have an external power source option. We will update this review in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: SHAN DEV

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this label maker!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so angry, I bought this label maker becuase supposedly you can buy a plug for it but the port where the plug would hook up to the machine is empty!! Also I have printed 5 labels off and even after putting the setting to bold print the words are faded and you can’t see some of the letters..
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: My daughter is very happy with this.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who likes to label everything. Had to buy extra label cartridges cause she was going through the one that came with this really fast.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi R.

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt last
customer_reviews.text: It was good while it lasted. LCD screen died less than a year after purchase. We didnt even use it very often. Everything else seemed to work ok though.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not for me....
customer_reviews.text: Did not work! Tried two new sets of batteries and it simply would not print! I should have gone with the Brothers model at nearly the same price. I already have a Brothers label printer that works great. This was a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Cactus Flower

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic label maker for a fantastic price.
customer_reviews.text: I am rating this 5 stars relative to it's price. As an engineer, I'm using to using very expensive cable labelers. I bought this however to label some stage lights at church. There's no question this is a basic labeler compared to an expensive Rhino or other label system, but it works well and supplies are amazingly cheap. If you don't use a label maker every day, this is about the best value out there. If you routinely print cable wrap labels, or need to label patch panels, look into a Rhino, or anything else that supports 1" tape.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This is an Awsome label maker, so easy to use and just the right size. Just as good or better than ones costing twice as much!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Heier

customer_reviews.title: Basic and Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: This model is basic and easy to use and gets the job done. It's easy to load cartridges and maneuvering around to find letters and make words is also easy enough, if a bit slow. Symbols are more tedious, but there is a great number of them and that is both the blessing and the curse. I didn't really see much difference in the font style, so I wouldn't purchase this if you are thinking of getting "fancy" script. It did exactly what I needed it to and I am very happy to have it on hand for future projects.
customer_reviews.author: Kym Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The product does not function as advertised. The Y button types a T. The print function does not work. A waste of money, I should have just saved myself the headache and $20 and bough a more expensive Avery. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Hoffard

customer_reviews.title: the older model was better
customer_reviews.text: It works fine but I honestly like my older model better. The older model had a shift key to access symbols on the keys. This one only has letters on the keys and you have to push a symbol button and scroll through a bunch of symbols to find the one you want.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: I really like having a labeler
customer_reviews.text: I really like having a labeler. This seems to work well, one star taken for the cut tool. It seems to get stuck often, and also, changed the batteries with 4 brands of brand new AA batteries, and it kept reading battery low in the middle of printing and shutting off , therefore wasting much paper labels. After deciding to remove everything for a while, (batteries/labels) I put batteries in again and so far is working good again. Still a great great product. Very happy I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa22

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker!
customer_reviews.text: My hand-held one died after about 20 yrs, so I thought I’d upgrade. Glad I did! Once you set this up, its easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: nancy carlson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This label maker is powered by batteries only, and it eats them. They don't last more than a few uses in this machine. It worked great the first couple of times, however after a few months, even with fresh batteries, the labels print like the ink is running out- except it doesn't take ink. I've cleaned the print heads to no avail. Wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: annadel

customer_reviews.title: Good item, but....
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I very much like this full size version.... the qwerty keyboard is easier for me. But, the label cartridges don't hold alot. Overall, I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M.J.

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: This label worked the first three times I used it. I am sorry that I didn’t read some of the negative reviews before purchasing it. The labels weren’t coming out of the machine, the device to cut it started acting up and the letters on the label were messed up.
customer_reviews.author: Motheroftwo

customer_reviews.title: Too basic
customer_reviews.text: Prints just fine - but the problem is you are limited to upper and lower case letters, and numbers. No punctuation available - such as dashes (-) or divisors (/) or colons, semicolons, etc. There are better devices out there, even by Dymo.
customer_reviews.author: MBA in the ICU

customer_reviews.title: I labeled my kids!
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty straight forward, you type something in the machine and it spits out a label. If that’s what you’re looking for, you found it!!
customer_reviews.author: DangerNacey

customer_reviews.title: Great product except...
customer_reviews.text: Good label maker but- the letter n does not work. Love the option for a border and other features
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Label all the things!! This gadget makes it a breeze! Increase or decrease the font size as needed! Extremely useful for labeling all the millions of charging cables in our house, as well as labeling our dogs' medicines so we make sure we give the right medicine to the right dog.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: The tape keeps getting stuck and jamming. The screen isnt very bright and can be hard to see in certain light. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Cabral

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as well as expected
customer_reviews.text: Loved this at first. It did exactly what I wanted and was a great price. But after I printed 3 labels, I switched the cartridge to the clear labels that also came with it and it is not printing the top half of the labels. I read the book and followed all the troubleshooting directions for cleaning the print head (though after only 4 labels, it shouldn't have needed cleaned already) and it still won't print on the clear labels. It is fine on the white labels though.
customer_reviews.author: Carissa

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic Tape Apparently No Longer Available
customer_reviews.text: This label maker works well enough. I had an older, smaller version that I used to make magnetic labels. It stopped working properly, so I purchased this. It is advertised as able to make magnetic labels and indeed does so on the magnetic tape I have. However, magnetic tape for this label maker appears to no longer be made. I advise against the LetraTag system if your goal is to make magnetic labels.
customer_reviews.author: David R Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Good all around label maker in terms of print quality. Somewhat odd to use. Very unreliable for a simple product - the LCD display went out and only displays vertical lines. I used it to print 2 labels over 18 months, and the unit no longer functions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DYMO Label Maker - Constantly Jams!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to upgrade my older DYMO label maker with this model. BIG MISTAKE. I've owned this for 2 years and the label maker consistently gets jammed. So much so, that either labeling tape stop working altogether - I assumed it was either the labeling tape or the machine. I decided to replace the labeling tape and it would work a few times and then break all over again. Not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Moe81317

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: The product didn't work. Put the batteries in, tried different pairs, and did not function.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Nice for organization
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use at my office. I got everything organized and able to read and I started using it at home also! I love how easy it is to use and the value for what I spent.
customer_reviews.author: tncurry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect label maker.
customer_reviews.text: I love this label maker. It is easy to use and I can finally label things around the house. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Prints well . Cutter broke in 3 months with very little use.  Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Cutter has issues. Otherwise would be a good unit. its worth 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: iluvtrinisoca

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This label maker works well. I got the power adapter for it because it uses a lot of batteries, and uses them quickly! The qwerty layout of this one makes it easier to use then others. Lots of frames to put around your lettering. Multiple sizes of letters and 2 line typing. Nice features. I recommend getting the power adapter so you don't have to hunt for new batteries every time you want to use it. Mine gets stored a lot of the time so I don't have to worry about batteries exploding that way too.
customer_reviews.author: AbbyNNK

customer_reviews.title: Good labeler, some sticky points...
customer_reviews.text: Good clear print, adjustable fonts, QWERTY kwys. On the downside-the screen can be seen only at a certain angle, label glue protection strips hard to get off.
customer_reviews.author: YU

customer_reviews.title: Cutter sticks after a cartidge worth of labels
customer_reviews.text: Works well, cartridges are cheaper and easier to find than cartridges for other label makers. Also, has a QWERTY keyboard instead of the unnatural alphabetic keyboard. My only issue with this label maker is that after about the first cartridge worth of labels, the cutter started to stick badly and I have to hit it several times to release.
customer_reviews.author: Moonlit Mechanic

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my sister because I have one myself. Works awesome, We label EVERYTHING! Phone cords get stolen all the time in my house and they are hard to ID because they are all white and we all have the same kind of phone. Now we name them all so we can fight over them and see who has whos. Its great. Perfect little machine. Get one! or two
customer_reviews.author: kasey kruft

customer_reviews.title: fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: what can i say. the keyboard is identical to what i am used to. it prints well. and stores easy. buy this one. you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Kat D.

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this more than body should. Love this! Edited: yes...more than I should have... I've already replaced every label twice. This was 3 months ago. This last time I Scotch taped them down, the labels don't stick.
customer_reviews.author: ljp

customer_reviews.title: Third time is the charm
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased LABELERS before and have been unsatisfied. Most use too much tape - putting a large amount of tape before and after the label. Tape is expensive and so this is a total waste of money. But this LABELER is very thrifty with tape. And the refills are easy to find at many locations and are not as expensive as mist others. And the quality of the labels is great. If you are looking for a LABELER that is inexpensive in use - taking into account the cost of the tape refills and how much tape is used for each label produced - this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Whatley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this label maker! It has a full keyboard & even some cute decorative things to add to the labels. I put little hearts on the labels in my daughters storage cubes.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Knecht

customer_reviews.title: Tape sticks to everything I have tried to label.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I've used this tape on many different surfaces and it sticks to them all. This has been a great help in my quest to be more organized!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Dorsey

customer_reviews.title: Just ok label maker
customer_reviews.text: This label maker is just okay. It's cheap and gets a basic job done. My biggest issue is that there is no way to center the text so when you print in extra small font half of the label is wasted and you dont even have an option to add a third line so again, the label space is just wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Am not a computer savvy as my kids say but this is super easy to use .
customer_reviews.author: Happysimplelife

customer_reviews.title: Add a Lable
customer_reviews.text: Its very light and easy to use. Must need when organizing.
customer_reviews.author: Bunsy

customer_reviews.title: Two of these faulty after 2 months - Tape Jam!
customer_reviews.text: I loved 'em when they worked. The first one deteriorated into a permanent "Tape Jam!" state. The second one did the same thing. Could be a bad lot, but I bought them from two different sites. I would never buy another Dymo product again. Tapes are extremely costly for the length, and now I have a bunch of tapes that will never be used. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Dearstyne

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Work great. Needed this for conducting this for my business
customer_reviews.author: Rahn93

customer_reviews.title: useful and great for organizing
customer_reviews.text: for the compulsive labeller, this is a must have. I labelled spice jars on the lid (why are spice jar labels only on the sides???), my kitchen looks professional now. I also bought the iron on tape to label my kid's jackets and stuff. things that tend to go missing at school. the fancy borders are a nice touch too. I do wish we can't print multiline on this.. but i guess that is for another model
customer_reviews.author: flygirl

customer_reviews.title: dyno label maker printing error
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in Dec, have made 4-5 little labels and now the label only prints the top half of what i need. something to do with a 'maple colored' tape (?) of something is broken. the label paper bunched up for whatever reason. I just wrote to Dymo as to this issue-will let you know what they say. this did a good job for what i needed but then again it wont work now that i need it!
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Have only had this label maker for about six weeks and have printed less than twenty labels. LCD screen is completely unreadable. Waste of money. Go with the Brother. Much more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: VinMan5000

customer_reviews.title: Cutter sticks
customer_reviews.text: I have used this item about 5 times and since the very beginning the cutting piece sticks and doesn’t cut. I have to pull the tape out and cut it by hand. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: rivers

customer_reviews.title: Screen died
customer_reviews.text: I bought the machine in 2018 and have barely used it in that time. It has just been sitting on a shelf, and has never been dropped or mistreated. I wanted to use it recently, but the screen has stopped working. I reached out to Dymo and they will not replace it or help me in any way. Avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a great label maker. Lots of symbols, multiple sizes, and a few other good features. Great label maker especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Linsey

customer_reviews.title: not great, qwerty layout is nice
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, not great, qwerty layout is nice, takes fairly convenient to find and afford label tape. It is a fairly convoluted process to adjust the font, sizes, add borders or insert any sort of symbol like &, *, # etc. But, it does print legible labels unlike other Dymo label makers I have had.
customer_reviews.author: WaterOtter

customer_reviews.title: Non-stick Deal breaker
customer_reviews.text: Shoulda listened.... not as easy to use as expected. Worst part is the tape does NOT stick, even to clean, flat plastic. Pretty much a bottom-line dealbreaker. Big bummer after spending time printing a bunch. I know, I should have tried a few before I keyed them all in.....
customer_reviews.author: ok2travel

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker!
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine had one of these and I liked it so much I had to get one! It's very handy! If you get one you'll find all kinds of things that you never knew needed labeling! They also have several different types of label tape. I've had no problems with mine so far, I've only had it for a week or two. It's easy to operate and works great. It runs on AA Batteries which is ok, but I wish it came with a power adapter. I'll probably order one soon.
customer_reviews.author: T Coe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use label maker
customer_reviews.text: I use this label maker for everything! It is easy to add a graphic, change to two line printing or edit before printing your label. I used it so far to label where toys belong in our toy room so the kids could put things away easier and the labels are all perfectly in tact after 2 months of being placed. I love this label maker.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.I

customer_reviews.title: Not great... but it works for me
customer_reviews.text: As you know, you get what you pay for. I wasn't entirely impressed with this label machine and was contemplating returning it... but it does serve my purpose of printing out basic labels, so I've decided to keep it simply because of what I paid for it. I don't think I'll get any benefit from buying a more expensive product. If you are just looking for a very basic label printer this should work for you just fine.
customer_reviews.author: franknbeanz

customer_reviews.title: Great product/seller
customer_reviews.text: Came when expected, no problems with product or seller. One very happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn10430

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker
customer_reviews.text: This has worked perfectly, shipping on time. Its truly helped me become a bit more organized. My kids loved it and found it easy to use also.
customer_reviews.author: Geopeach209

customer_reviews.title: Compact and great
customer_reviews.text: Don’t like the clear it comes with but it’s great
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Good for home use
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use. The printer is not print that fast but it is fine for just home use. I have been using it to label my son's personal stuff for his daycare, label my canning jars, household equipment and so on. The letters stay very well on plastic tape even I wash them( I put on my son's cups). Problem so far was paper jam. It happened sometime and it was so annoying. You have to pull some out and cut it.
customer_reviews.author: R.Ras

customer_reviews.title: Can't read the screen well
customer_reviews.text: It does the work but I can't see the screen hardly at all be a use its too dark and the keys are too far apart making it awkward to type on. Plus it's just bigger than necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Prints great, but doesn't stick
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to label plastic bins in my office, and my storage unit. While I was quite pleased with the capabilities of the label printer, I have found that the labels themselves do not stick very well. On the smaller containers, the labels are on a curved surface on the lid; I have found that the labels become detached at one end or the other. On the larger bins, the labels were on flat surfaces, but they tend to fall off in the process of moving the bins.
customer_reviews.author: Archon

customer_reviews.title: Dead to the world thi pos.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this stored away for almost a year. Just opened today. It is brand new out of the package and will not turn on. Nothing. Dead. Followed the instructions and it will not function. In the meantime the project I was going to use this for lies in my dinning room spread out everywhere. At least my cat is having fun. I need a replacement sent now.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of use, but it won't cut plastic label tape and only prints on half the label. I love to label things, but all of the scrap makes me feel very wasteful.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K.

customer_reviews.title: Good basic labeler
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd unit. After a few years, may quit cutting the tape as well, and they do not print as deeply. Still it's a nice basic labeler.
customer_reviews.author: Hay Seed

customer_reviews.title: Hungry little labeler
customer_reviews.text: While it prints decent labels, it gobbles batteries like they're popcorn. I wouldn't buy this again given the choices available today. Find one with an included AC adapter option if possible - it's worth it after a few cycles of batteries
customer_reviews.author: StartHere

customer_reviews.title: awkward bottom row
customer_reviews.text: I got a qwerty keyboard label maker so it would be easier to find the keys, but that bottom row is "shifted over". It is not conventionally aligned; VERY ANNOYING. You would expect letters V and B to be in the center, but it is C and V. I constantly have to go back and correct my typos. DYMO what were you thinking? Aside from that it works pretty well. Does the basic job.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this label maker. It is much more user friendly than my old one (also a DYMO) It has a lot of options, so my kids (Aged 8 and 11) actually liked that Mom was labeling all their stuff for school. I wanted this one so I can get the iron on labels and label school coats and such. I haven't tried it yet, but I have seen it on other peoples belongings, and it is very durable and easy to read, even after repeated washings.
customer_reviews.author: jules

customer_reviews.title: Dymo is dynamite!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter's birthday; she loves it! She homeschools, co-teaches literature/writing with a homeschool group, and has a LOT of activity to keep track of. These labels are helping her be more organized (then she already is!) with all the school stuff. This has some bells and whistles, but can also be easily used right out of the package.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Use original tape
customer_reviews.text: Always use the original tape to get better results, don’t use knock off tape
customer_reviews.author: raman bahlawan

customer_reviews.title: It's a great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love the change in the keyboard instead of the alphabet ordered one.
customer_reviews.author: Diane L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great variety of symbols, sizes, ease of use Would like to see this tool with multiple tape size feature.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Cannot run on AC adapter
customer_reviews.text: Despite the description saying it can operate on an AC adapter, there is no port to accept it. Amazon will refund
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: Yeah for technology
customer_reviews.text: Modern technology has come a long way since I first had my Dymo label maker. Easy to understand and easy to pop in the cartridge. Just type away, hit print, and cut.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Over 4 years and still going strong...
customer_reviews.text: I use rechargeable batteries, so drain is not an issue for me. I've labeled our whole house. Makes my husband crazy, lol. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Eliot

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: The label maker is just we needed for a small office setting. It is easy to use and replacement tape quick to replace from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have used this device before and it usually works well. I just got mine today and there is either no ink or it's defective Because my labels are not printing solid letters. I am very disappointed. Especially since the directions don't say anything about an ink so that leads me to believe that it is defective. Hurt because I needed this for an event on Monday.
customer_reviews.author: Amesha Fentress

customer_reviews.title: Love my new model!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a different DYMO Letra Tag unit that I lost in my recent move. I love this one better than the first one. I like that it has a querty keyboard and can be used while it is still on a table. My only wish is that I ordered other paper cartridges because I like to have more options than clear and paper.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

product_meta.title: DYMO LetraTag LT-100H Handheld Label Maker for Office or Home (21455)
product_meta.description: Size Name:Label Maker| Style Name:LT 100H PlusFeaturing a compact, handheld design with easy-to-navigate buttons and a mountable magnetic holder, the DYMO LetraTag Plus personal label maker prints your customized labels on LetraTag paper, available in paper, plastic, or metallic (sold separately). the LCD display allows you to preview before you print, and provides five font sizes, seven print styles (normal, bold, italic, outline, shadow, vertical, and underline), eight box styles, and 195 symbols. You can also select from three language options: English, French, and Spanish. The DYMO label maker uses four “AA” batteries or optional AC adapter (sold separately).
feature_bullets: Handheld label maker has 2-line printing, 5 font sizes, 7 print styles, 8 box styles. 9-label memory, date stamp, and 3 language options.
13-character LCD screen and graphical display on this label printerlets you see messages, and font and effects on-screen before printing.
Prints on LetraTag LT labels available in plastic, metallic, magnetic and iron-on label varieties. Thermal printing needs no ink or toner.
Automatic-off saves power. easy-to-navigate, quick-access buttons for swift and easy label making.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars5,778 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
